thread.title: Talvar: 10am housefull at Noida halls
thread.title_full: Talvar: 10am housefull at Noida halls - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Talvar: 10am housefull at Noida halls
text:
Talvar opened to filled theatres in Noida on Friday morning. The curiosity among people in Noida about the movie was palpable since Thursday evening, since it's based on an incident that every Noidawallah had heard or read about, if not seen the developments closely.
READ: Everything you need to know about 'Talvar'
Listen to songs of Talvar on Gaana.com
Stoic silence, palpable anger
Inside the movie hall, emotions were running high. During the screening, someone shouted, "Justice was denied. Naukaron ka kaam tha woh ." Kavya, a college student, said, "They had the audacity to do a character assassination of a girl who had already died and to say that the family practised wife-swapping. Many of us were made to believe that the Talwars had no morality. I mean, this was deplorable."
Watching Talvar was on my priority list
The paid previews and the morning shows were running almost housefull . The residents of Jal Vayu Vihar, where the Talwars lived, and from neighbouring sectors, came in hordes. "It was an incident that happened in front of us. We saw the whole drama unfold every day. For years, we had seen the police, CBI officials and even the media doing their investigations. Watching Talvar was my top priority," said Mayank Bhandari, a resident of Jal Vayu Vihar.
Spine-chilling thriller
Shweta, a college student, after watching the film on Thursday night, said, "It's a spine-chilling thriller. There were so many things that we didn't know, like how the internal politics of the investigating agencies played such a pivotal part in the final findings."
